result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Eggers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time shall be served consecutive to any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation previously imposed shall remain the same as conditions of Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not be present where drugs are used or sold.  
Defendant shall have no contact with Co-defendant, Kristin Wendels.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
